intro: Cyanea obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaf Cyanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyanea obtusa is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
